etymologies: late 17th century (as tessellated): from late Latin tessellat-, from the verb tessellare, from tessella, diminutive of tessera (see tessera)

definitions: decorate or cover (a surface) with a pattern of repeated shapes, especially polygons, that fit together closely without gaps or overlapping

examples.text: the pavement is tessellated with slabs of white and rose-colored marble

shortDefinitions: decorate with pattern of repeated shapes

definitions: (of shapes, especially polygons) fit together closely without gaps or overlapping

examples.text: hexagons are strong, symmetrical, and tessellate perfectly

shortDefinitions: (of shapes) fit together without gaps or overlapping
